intro: Odontarrhena singarensis, commonly known as the Singarensis grass, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its tufted growth habit with slender, erect stems. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, two-lobed flowers. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native environment. Odontarrhena singarensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its region.
